meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6475.

td.p: Marion Penning, a high school science and history teacher from Baltimore, Maryland
Chris Pae, a high school history teacher from Suwanee, Georgia
Robin Cheney, a middle school teacher from Rancho Santa Margarita, California

tr.td: (Kelly: A land forged by war and rebellion, emerging today as a blend of ancient tradition, and modern success.)

div.h3: Scores at the first commercial break (after clue 15):
Scores at the end of the Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: (Alex: For example, if I read the clue "As a coloring agent", your response would be "What is pigment?")

(Alex: And we want an element as a response. I'll give you an example. If I said "The abbreviation for 'company'", your brain would work and say "Oh, the abbreviation for 'company' is Co., Co is the symbol for cobalt." We want the element as your response.)

')

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: I think the ice one is kind of easy, but the other one, it helps if you can do the math.)
ChrisWhat is the Titanic & Triangle Shirtw
$7,401
RobinWhat is the Chicago Fire and the Titanic
$12,000
MarionWhat the Titanic sinking and the Hindenberg
$7,401
the Titanic sinking & the Hindenburg')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'In 2012 the National Postal Museum marked the 75th & 100th anniversaries of these 2 disasters with an exhibit called "Fire & Ice"')

tr.td: In 2012 the National Postal Museum marked the 75th & 100th anniversaries of these 2 disasters with an exhibit called "Fire & Ice"

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law. This website is not affiliated with, sponsored by, or operated by Jeopardy Productions, Inc. Join the discussion at JBoard.tv.
